review: It's busy all the time. In my two trips I've had ok food. Both times the sweet potato and regular fries came out kinda warm till the refill. My fancy aoli burger was not that hot and the previous chicken sandwich was juicy but sat under a heat lamp.  My two servers have been opposites; one was a rock star the other I had to ask for everything. I'm still going with 4 stars.  Bathrooms are clean and the over place is clean. Parking is huge out front.

December 22, 2017, long day, had my husband picked up a couple of BUNLESS Shroom burgers, preordered, online, paid, pickup time 5:15p. [WE ARE CARB SENSITIVE PEOPLE SO NO WHEAT OR SUGAR IN OUR DIETS] from the Redlands location, we appreciate this menu substitution offer. He arrives, food isn't ready...Hostess is pretty much vacant in the head.  It was busy.  Couldn't find the order.  When the order does arrive, the hostess hands him a cup of fries along with the order...um what?  Food finally comes out at 5:35p.  Item was supposed to be Lettuce Wrap.  The container did state Mushroom Lettuce Wrap. Management in this location needs a serious revamp. At home: We open the containers.  The food is a mess...it basically was a burger patty with cheese and mushrooms with lettuce/salad strewn all over the place.  I wish I had taken a photo, however, hunger prevailed at this point. The burger was awful, we had to salt the food several times...I'm not sure what is going on with Red Robin, however this isn't an isolated incident, we had a similar experience when visiting in WA a couple of years back. I guess you can say they are consistent with poor customer service.   We will seriously reconsider ever returning, the Habit and Five Guys are my burgers joints from this point on.  Wow, just Wow.

located in citrus plaza across from target, there's plenty of parking and is easy to find. the wait is ok, depends on when you come in but for a monday evening, wait was 10 mins.  BLEU RIBBON BURGER - bomb. i went yesterday and was planning to get something else but nothing else looks as good as this burger. love everything about it from the sauce to the bun. i like my burgers medium. :) MILKSHAKES - i've had the strawberry banana and the oreo. both are good but i like the oreo a lot more. FRIES - they offer sweet potato fries, regular fries, and garlic fries at an extra cost. the fries are a hit or miss.. but it's ok. they're bottomless.  * their sweet potato fries are good with spicy ketchup.  service and food is better here compared to the red robin in tyler mall, riverside.

Business is good as usual here. I ordered the BBQ Whiskey Burger along with the tower of onion rings. The beef was made well done like I asked and the tower of onion rings were nice and crispy, just the way it should be. Our waiter, Hugo, was very attentive, service was fast, and the food came out quickly. I wish I could put out a longer review and critique on something at least, but I don't think that's necessary since everything was on point. Well done as always Red Robin.

I don't know why I continue to come to this stupid Red Robin. It never failed something always happens here. Me and my husband don't have date night very often being that we have town little one.  And I ordered a crispy sandwich and it was raw in the inside. So I told Sky the server and she rock it back. Tell me why it took 20 mins to get my sandwich which I told them to cancel because we had movie tickets. So all Skye said was we took you sandwich off the bill and gave you a discount. No I'm sorry nothing. Skye was not a nice server at all. This Red Robin Gourmet Burgers is not good at all. Thank you for ruining my date night.

Food was great. I enjoyed a black and bleu burger while my wife ate the smoke n pepper burger. Garlic fries were also the way to go. This review, however, is more about the service we received rather than their food. Simply put, our server gave my wife and I the best service we've received in the 5 years we've been together. My wife and I frequent many restaurants and Kaitlynn (our server) was exceptional and second to none in terms of comparing her to any other sever we've had at any other restaurant we've been to. She was friendly, checked in on us enough, was very prompt, and was always around.  I'm not sure what else to say. Thank you Kaitlynn for making our dining experience great! Being an awesome server takes effort and you did everything right today!

Great service  Stick to their premium Burgers and salads. I tried there Pub MACn Cheese and it was tasteless, I sent it back and the Chef thru some cheese on it and microwaved it. Yuck! The waitress was so nice she took it off our bill.

I'm gonna put this 2 stars the waitresses and other workers pls have some respect for other racist! Ridiculous!!! American ppl pls have some respect to other racist who are dark it was dec 17 I know it gets busy but to ignore one person who is hungry just because this person is dark??? Come on!!! I feel this food place is racist

Date Night 2017: we waited for five minutes The hostess did we want to sit in a bar. We said sure. Then we got sat in the back row  Everyone was chatty and friendly. I used my rewards app which was good. Happy hour Is all day which is nice and we had two $6 burgers. And desert.

Came here in the early evening with my family. It was busy but our waitress was on her "A" game! My husband order the blue cheese burger, my son ordered corn dogs, and I ordered a Caesar salad. Everyone loved their food but me. The lettuce on my salad wasn't Roman but just a regular leafy green salad so I was disappointed. Overall we had a great experience and will definitely be back the next time we stay at our cabin.

Joseph took great care of us last night. The wait wasn't too bad, the food was amazing. I live the variety on the kids menu. I ordered my toddlers mini corndogs w/ broccoli & meatballs w/ corn & our server suggested cheese sauce for dipping. It was all fresh & hot & so much better than the usual chicken, mac & cheese or cheap burger at most places. My babies devoured their plates. I got the Fiery Ghost (I think) tavern burger. It was so good! It was super spicy, everything was fresh. Considering how busy they were, everything arrived quickly & we were checked on frequently. This was only my 4th trip to a Red Robin (2nd at this location) and I'll definitely be back.

Great establishment, Great service, fast paced enviornment, good food! there hasn't been anything here I didn't like. Cool atmosphere.  Nice big wrap around bar. Lots of room. Thanks for the great time RR!!  WE WILL BE BACK

Great service!!! Great ambiance. Unlimited wedge fries! Sam Adams Seasonal beer was amazing. Food pretty good. Bar is awesome.  TV's not too high up making viewing comfortable. Low lighting.  Finally! Only BJ's matches them.  Light years better than the old Red Robin! A must for hanging out.
An ok Hamburger restaurant. A bit noisy and overpriced for their food.  Restaurant clean and server helpful. Food a bit pricy but fairly reasonable Restaurant is clean staff friendly.

Came here to enjoy a family dinner, my family has different schedules so rarely do i go out to eat with them, was waiting in the bar area i am 21 was not ordering a drink and i was asked to move because i did not see a valid reason to show him an ID if i am not ordering a drink, Chad ever so rudely removed me from the area with intimidating comments *mind you i am a female with two other females waiting over 20 minutes for a table* As he proceeded to seat my family and i, he made a weird spiteful comment ' are you okay? '  he knew what he did was unprofessional and unacceptable and i will not be returning after this derogatory behavior. I have never been stared at during the whole duration of a meal so uncomfortably by a male employee at a restaurant.

Red Robin is a staple at pretty much any populated area, but I've always been satisfied with my visits at this particular location. The service has been great and the food has always been as expected as far as Red Robin's standards go. It's a pretty busy restaurant so try to avoid dinner on the weekends! Just as a general rule of thumb, I always ask for fries right after we order--that way we have something to munch on while waiting for the food. To be frank, and I still don't understand why, a lot of waiters seem to get annoyed by me asking for fries before our food. This has been my experience at a number of Red Robin chains, but this is the only one where they seem completely fine by it. That said, don't forget to order a bunch of their different sauces to go with the fries--especially the campfire sauce! It's honestly a super convenient spot for a birthday party or large get-together since they have the space to accommodate. Tends to get a little loud inside too!

Evan our waiter  was so awesome always aware  of what we needed and asking if we needed anything. We asked for a couple things  as my husband referred to as "chapters " kept asking for boxes and bags etc....yet he was not bothered  even at 8 in the evening  on Cinco de Mayo Also wait time was awesome  ... waiting  about 3 mins on Cinco de Mayo.

Great place for a quick dinner if you're on the run with the family. They're quick with friendly service and clean! Just come about 30 minutes before you actually are ready to eat because this location gets crowded!

Love the food here.  Usually sit in tbd bar with my husband and get great service.  Although tight I came with my daughter and granddaughter. (Couldn't sit in bar) Was told it would be a 15 minute wait.  Turned into a 35 minute wait! Complained to the manager.  He apologised, but you could tell he didn't care.  Finally get seated.  Waiter gets our drinks farely quickly, but food took forever! Then my fries were like ice cold! After getting that fixed,  our waiter disappeared. Finally ordered dessert on the table kiosk. 10 minutes later our waiter our show's up and ask if there will be anything else? Well, yes the dessert we ordered. Oh, he says, I'll check. So we get that, it's delicious. Sit and wait. Our waiter has disappeared again! So we were going to pay cash, but dug out some cards and paid on the kiosk. Left,  having never seeing our waiter again!

PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE! I made an order last Friday the screwed it up 2 times I called and spoke with a manager, I was told I would be refunded. This never happened! So my husband called on Monday to find out the progress. Our bank is very good with crediting us back they blamed corporate and our bank. They called me yesterday saying they can't find my ticket and if a gift card is acceptable. NOPE! I will never eat here again. Since I'm ill hubby is going down there today to give them the order number again. (Edited to redact former statements)This is insane,unacceptable  and now I realize this and I hope you will too.UPDATE: after hubby went down to the restaurant he was told that they would call IT to get the records back for the lost purchase. I'll update again next week. I gave an extra star for going the hard route to fix the issue.

Elia is the worst waitress. Took 25 minutes for her to bring me coffee. Didn't remember my mom's shake she ordered and messed up her order. Had to call a manager over after still no shake after 30 minutes. She still hasn't checked on us or asked if we needed refills or boxes. Had to flag the manager down for the check. I go out to eat at least twice a day and she's the most incompetent waitress I've had this month. This red Robbin always has the worst waiters I swear. Food was decent, service was horrible, host was friendly. Not coming here again for sure

I love this place! I always come for the garlic parmesan fries. I really like this place because of the ambience and the staff are very attentive to your needs and the food is always on point. I've never had an issue with anything. Also if you ever go here you have to try   shakes. They had a limited time blue moon shake and it was to die for.

Horrible horrible service. Went with my family party of six and the only time we saw the waitress was when we ordered drinks and food. Never got a refill of fries and had to chase her down to pay. Disappointed that she intentionally ignored us for whatever reason. Especially since we were more than patient despite the rude service
Had an early dinner here on 08/10 food was perfect are waitress Summer was awesome very attentive and friendly she was on top of refills before we even requested them.
Sever was very nice and attentive..Food , especially the fries were good. There was many choices of patties and even a garden burger and a boca burger .most places only have 1 kind.

Always a great place to come with the family. Be careful with the computer thing on the table though. If you have kids it's easy for the kids to by the 1.99 unlimited games... didn't realize it until last time I went. They can also make the burgers double patties! If you are feeling hungry!

Today we waited for 20 minutes for a table. During this time we saw 3 groups of people leave due to the long wait. While we were being seated we passed 7 tables that were empty and clean. These tables were spread evenly throughout the main dining area. We passed the manager as we were being seated. Our service was good and the food was delivered in a timely manner. I would recommend that the manager get more involved so that Red Robin does not lose business in the future.

Only 3 stars because of the idiot manager. We are her tonight for my birthday burger, my birthday is next Friday,  we come in and are told to go chose a table in the bar and we will bring your menus. Well, there was 1 both that a certain had just got up from, so we sat, we pushed everythi g to the edge f the have, and a busboy came and cleaned the tavke. Then 5-7 minutes passed and we didn't get the menus or a hello... so I went and asked the hostess girls for menus and asked them to let someone know we are here... anyhow the manager idiot came to the table to tell me that no one came to the table because we sat at a dirty table... really you dumb ass... really? The hostess knew, the busboy knew, whoever had this table before knew... anyways he needs to stay away from tables. Our service was freat, our food was great but that guy is not so great.

Ordered a whiskey Rio chicken salad to go from my smartphone. The app allows for a request to avoid alergic ingredients but nothing in the salad description mentioned cilantro, which I am alergic to so I didn't request it be left off. Who puts cilantro on a bbq chicken salad?! When I got it home I realized that the server forgot to include salad dressing as well! So I went hungry. Thanks a lot, RR!
The waitress was unbelievably rude, with attitude. Never have I been here with such bad service.

This place is rediculous, Came in two adults 1 child 2 high chairs needed. Place was packed we put our name in. Hostess was extremely rude from the get go. We waited and she sat everyone who came in before or after us. Some parties  having same amount of people. We were finally seated and on our way to our table, I seen a manager and tried to talk to him about it and he could care less.  Our waiter is excellent  but will not be coming back to Redlands Red Robin
Awsome service and amazing food . Great service always positive and good waiters attitudes it's always good that every time you go too a place repeatly you get great service .. love this location .
Ordered a chicken burger. I know at a burger place? Say what? Service was relaxed and made us somewhat comfortable. Everyone enjoyed the visit.

Never a bad experience at this place and it's still holding a great track record for myself and my family.. brought my 2 little ones for a bite and though my boys meatballs on a stick seemed hard or stale or even over cooked, he still ate them lol (well, about a third of them) we relayed the info to our server And asked for another choice on the menu...since he had already eaten most of what was on his plate we didn't expect the manager to approach us w apologies and letting us know he would be taking the meatballs off of our check VERY COOL!! Servers are great the staffs communication w the manager and customers is great! We will be back in no time!

The staff is consistently friendly, even when they are busy, which is why I'm giving them a 4 star. The service is usually pretty quick. The food is not epic but not bad for a chain restaurant. It seems like the portions have gotten smaller. I like the avo cabo salad, but wish it was bigger. My son like the burgers and the fries (still a big portion there). My husband ordered the seafood scatter today. The portion wasn't generous but it tasted fine.

I went here today with my son and my husband.  We walked inside and the girl greeted us as we walked in ,it was a 15 min wait so it was cool . The lady walked us to our table she was very nice and friendly. I ordered a teriyaki grilled chicken burger with sweet potato fries and the teriyaki sauce on the side and a side salad with ranch dressing, i also got a peach raspberry ice tea everything was very good . My son ordered a bacon avocado cheese burger with fries, my son liked it alot . My husband ordered a new bacon avocado grilled chicken with no bun burger with fries and he also got a berry lemonade that was a sparkling drink it was all very good . Then I ordered a bacon avocado cheese burger with garlic fries to go with 2 ranch dressing for my oldest son. The to go order was even very good ,our waiter was very nice she was very friendly and had great customer service ,we will be definitely coming back here to eat again ,this place is a great place to eat at . We have been coming here since this place opened up and have always had great service and great food .

Party of 11. Most of us had burgers & fries. We had 4 different sauces to dip our fries & none of it was ketchup. But, all fry dips were selish! There was a Southern burger, a GDB, & pepper bacon burger. We also had the Seafood Scramble, CA Chicken, chili, and a milkshake. And a few of us may have dominated the trivia game....

The service here is way better than the Rancho store. The service are actually real humans! They talk and interact with their diners. They work for their well deserved tips. Just giving 4 stars coz the RR chain does not have WiFi. I tipped my server well. I asked her for loaded fries to go. She really loaded it! Ha!  Fellow Yelpers Redlands Red Robin I highly recommend!

Always have a good time at this location. Food is excellent, service was timely even for a busy Saturday night, and the staff is always friendly. This is probably my favorite Red Robin location to visit.

Was here last week spending a night out with my son.. food was excellent and server did a good job..I wanted to give a special thanks to Kent Cunningham the assistant general manager who went above and beyond his job duties by finding my son's retainer that he had left on the table.thank you for making a night that could have ended terribly a good one Kent

Worst service ever! They completely ruined my birthday dinner! Left us thirsty, got order wrong, very rude to my boyfriend and I! He's a very generous tipper, and this is the first time he's not tipped at all! It was that bad! If you're an interracial couple, do not eat here! Will never come back!

Nice place, server was attentive, the app was very helpful for calorie and macro tracking for everything I ate. It even has a feature that lets you remove any component of the meal and it then recalculates the nutritional info. Props to Red Robin for thinking of this. Will be back soon.

I hadn't been to Red Robin in years, but for some reason I had a craving for the "bottomless" steak fries and a burger. Wifey wasn't going to argue, she is always down for a burger. The kids will eat anywhere that there are games to play at the table, so we braved that parking lot lot full of morons (Citrus Plaza and Lugonia right in front of it), and made our way inside. After a few minutes waiting in the lobby area, we were helped by a Hostess and seated almost immediately. Just on time too, because a grip of people walked in at that point. When she seated us, we asked if we could get an extra tablet/kiosk deal for the kids (2) so that they could both play games at the same time without fighting over it. She told us no, that each table was limited to just one. I could understand if we brought an entire Legion of children in, but we were only asking for one more. Every other restaurant we have ever requested this from has happily given us an extra one. That was mildly annoying.  We sat down and our server immediately came to our table and introduced himself. Real friendly Dude, sort of looked like a clean-cut "Shaggy" from "Scooby-Doo". But in a good way. Very welcoming and attentive, he never once allowed a drink on our table to go empty. A real credit to the staff. We ordered for the kids first, because they tend to take for....ev....er to eat their food. We got them an order of Cluck-A-Doodles and fries to share, as they didn't seem as hungry as me and the Mrs were. Couple of Lemonades for both of them.The chicken strips were standard fare, nothing you couldn't buy frozen and make at home. This is usually the case at most chain restaurants, so we don't hold it against Red Robin. The kids ate most of them, and all the fries so mission accomplished on that front.  We discovered that the Root Beer Floats and Strawberry Lemonades are bottomless now, so my Wife got the Lemonade, and I couldn't resist the Root Beer Floats. Her Lemonade came out looking very appealing in a fancy glass. It was good stuff, very refreshing. My first Root Beer float came out looking extra nice, but every time I got a refill, it started to look like they put less and less effort into it, to the point where the last one looked like a murky broth sort of like a pint of Guiness dumped into a glass, with WAY too much foam in it. Whatever, it was still good. I ordered the Fiery Ghost Style Tavern Double, medium rare. It was alright, not bad. It wasn't very spicy, and the bun was rendered into paste before I was finished. Kind of like when your Mom made Hamburgers with bread sliced instead buns when you were a kid. But I did enjoy it overall, I just wasn't amazed or anything. My Wife got a Tavern Double, cooked medium. She liked it enough to eat it all, but then again, she is pregnant with twins. She did mention that it hit the spot, so we will chalk this burger up as a victory. The steak fries have always been a factor in my coming to Red Robin. They used to be SO bomb; crispy and golden on the outside, soft and tasty on the inside. But then they went "bottomless" years ago, and it seems like the quality has suffered. They are just standard now, not really good enough to make you need them to be bottomless.  We have been coming to Red Robin for years, but they used to be better. Just like most chain restaurants, the quality starts to wane. But this location usually provides us with a good dining experience. We will come back someday.....

Let me start off with saying that the food is great! The atmosphere of the restaurant is nice. Management table touches which is awesome. Every server that I've had has been very courteous and well trained, especially Sky aka bartender/server. She's amazing. However, I did not give 5 stars since the hostesses all have attitude. Which is horrible since they're setting the vibe and the first impressions. Like EVERY SINGLE time each hostess will roll their eyes and look like they hate life... I come at least every other week. I work in the industry so I pay attention to detail. Anyways they definitely won't get promoted to where the real money is with those attitudes!

We came here on a Saturday afternoon to the bar area to get some lunch. At first everything seemed to be going pretty well. Service was okay, we ordered promptly, and the food came out rather quickly, but here's where it went South: The burgers were not cooked as we ordered, since we asked for medium and received rather well done burgers... Sooooooo someone tell the chef to go back culinary school.  The bottomless fries that came with our overcooked burgers seemed more like a garnish, since they literally gave us a small handful for two people. The main reason we came here was for their bottomless fries, so there goes that.  The blond, blue eyed waitress we had must have been a magician because that girl disappeared for our entire stay.  Not once were we offered refills... We had to use bus boys and other waitresses to try to get her to come to our table. Once the bus boy got her to come to us, after waiting for her for 30 mins, she came and asked what we needed... Really? So we asked for water and some fries, and she turned away, mid-sentence, to walk away from us, so I had to say, hey hold on, we aren't done ordering! Wtf???  Anyway, so she left, came back, yep, you guessed it, with no fries or sauce, just water. Mind you, that was my second glass of water throughout our entire stay. Meanwhile, we decided to pay via the little prompt/pay machine they have at the bar, which by the way, you can use to call your server over... Which we did, and no, she never came. Lovely. So anyway, we pay, and no receipt comes out. Alright. So when she came back with the water, she was carrying a bunch of receipts, and asked us which amount was ours and what we paid with. Ummm isn't that your job?? After we gave her that info, we never even got a receipt. Well, since we had told her we wanted more fries and sauce, we hoped she would come back with those after the receipt fiasco. But something even better happened: 15 mins later, at 4:20ish, we saw her, with a bag of food inside her purse, just... Walk out.  We looked at each other, and said screw this, let's leave and never return. Considering we've had bad experiences at other Red Robin locations, we are boycotting this establishment indefinitely. Bad service, small, well done burgers, lack of fries and water simply do not make a good visit. I'd get better service from myself at home. She didn't deserve the tip we gave her and she spoiled the rest of our Saturday. Thanks.

I normally really enjoy red robin. Went there the other night, server informed us that the kitchen was about to close. We didn't think anything of it, until the next morning when both my friend and I were throwing up. We had both ordered chicken and I'm assuming the cooks were in a rush to get out- therefore not cooking our meals throughly. I'm sadly Disappointed! :(

If I could give it zero stars, I would. To start, the waiter never put in appetizer order, sat for a ridiculous amount of time (with a toddler) not even being acknowledged, and by the time the food came-it was COLD! The only time we were asked how the meal was was when we were paying and when we told the manager (I'm assuming since he was in regular clothes) the food was cold he responded with "next time give us an opportunity to bring you hot food!) we would have been more than happy to request warm food if anyone would have approached us during the meal to check on it! What a waste of $50!

I went for my bday with 7 family members and they took like 30 minutes to bring the food to the table and the worst part was that when they brought the food all orders were wrong all orders were missing grilled onions and also one of the hamburgers didn't get to the table after 15 min that all orders arrived.

Well, service started off bad as the greater never called out our name and we waited longer than what was told to us.Then refused to look me and my husband in the eye about it when we came back asking why we were never called. After begin seated, I was so upset I asked to speak to the manage. He apparently already knew our name and apologize that our name was taken off the list. Hummm... So it was out in and deliberately removed. Interesting. All in all the waitress was nice and they gave us 20% off the bill for the inconvenience. But we had to get out of there because the food was so bad. The buns was squishy white bread not gourmet bread, the nachos didn't have a enough cheese and the fries was bottomless but so nasty you didn't want anymore. I have had great Red Robin food so it's gotta be this location. I'm writing this because of the food, not because the server was acting dumb when we called her out. The bad cooking was the icing on the cake. Second start for them trying to accommodate our inconvenience butt even if that didn't happen the food was still nasty.

I tried to order on line but the order didn't go through so I called it in. I ordered 2 burgers , fries and 2 cod plates. I live 5 miles away the burgers and fries were cold. The cod meals were missing the tarter sauce.

Stephaine our waitress was so awesome and very patient with ourlarge family. Went to celebrate my son 17th birthday   We had a wonderful time and the food was great. Thank you Stephaine for awesome service.
Our server Hugo was awesome. Usually when I order the bottomless garlic fries I see one maybe 2 baskets, but not with Hugo. My french fry angel.
My Southern charm burger was great! The service was over the top good. My glass never ran empty! I think the management has a great attitude that reflects in its people!

We came here today and had the best waiter. I was talking way too much and he came back to the table 4 times until I was actually ready to order (Ooops!). He was super nice an the food was amazing. We haven't been here in ages and will 100% be back when Alessandro is working! Never complained about how annoying I was about not being ready to order and still helped us out with ordering the best options on the menu for the money. Highly recommend him as a server!

I like this location. Very clean awesome servers. I only like to sit in the bar area because they have the best severs. They have full menu in the bar. It gets extremely noisy in the main eating area the bar area is actually quieter.

I come here atleast once a month. The staff is always friendly and I love their whiskey river bbq burger. I've never had to wait more then 5 minutes to be seated even when it's crowded. This is my favorite restaurant!
Wait is a not long but expected on a weekend. Hosted can do a better job accommodating larger crowds. I have seen other establishments hand out appetizers during the long wait .
today was of the better experiences that i have had in rr, the burgers were delicious and our waitress, never left of serve, incredible place!

Good food, decent service, fun but noisy atmosphere. Good burgers, good wraps, good salads, just good food in general. They offer vegetarian options for most all their meat items on the menu. Gets very busy.

Food was good as usual but I gave them three stars because the restaurant seems to struggle with cleanliness. Things are often disheveled and the women's bathroom is amazingly unkempt. I can't imaging the servers/employees are actually able to wash up and come out if there clean enough to serve food. Out of soap. Out of paper towels. Out of TP. I reported this to two different people. No one addressed during the hour I was there. (We sat by the hallway to the bathroom.). I have been there repeatedly since they remodeled and it is usually in shabby shape. Too bad. I know this is not about the food but I hate having to take my daughter in that bathroom and she loves this restaurant.

What could I possibly say about this Red Robin? Let's see... I've been coming here for years; heck, ever since this location opened up in what is known today as Citrus Plaza. In those few years I've had some great times and some displeasurable times here. I have always loved Red Robin and their burgers. I've tried many, many different ones. Sometimes, when the mood has struck me, I have even crossed over into their chicken sandwich territory and both have been good as a whole. To say that I have never had a few problems or hiccups here regarding food or service is an understatement. This place is NOT perfect, which in reality is fine because no place is. What this Red Robin does very well is the way they carry themselves and their level of customer service. Out of all the times I have had issues here, every single one of them has been made right and as a patron I certainly appreciate that. So, as such, I will keep coming back to partake of their tasty food. Some tips- Most peeps get the bottomless fries or garlic fries as a side w/ their burger or sandwich, but you can also sub that out for either bottomless cole slaw, broccoli, or salad. Also, don't think that the burger creations they have listed on their menus are set in stone; you have the power to customize your burgers as you see fit. My personal go to is a Banzai Burger on an onion bun w/ pickles, onion straws, and an egg added. Bar booths and seating are generally first come first serve. My real only gripe (not w/ this particular location, but w/ the Red Robin chain as a whole) is that lately it feels to me that Red Robin is starting to become a bit to pretentious. I mean, I miss the days of the simple, fold out menus w/ the burgers served in a basket. Now the menus look like some you'd find at The Cheesecake Factory and their burgers are served on these "fancy" red plates w/ the fries served in a metal cylindrical container adjacent to the burger. Still good though. Yummmm....

Went expecting a great burger with awesome bottomless fries with the family starving and ready to eat!  We were sat quickly since we called ahead and greeted quickly drinks came in a timely manner though it took a bit to order after that or all took a down hill we had Cici as a server and the food took a really long time and refills we had to wait for my mom had to get up and ask for more hot water! My sister got the pretzel app since she was craving pretzels and they were over cooked slitly burnt and the sauce really was not good at all! We took the kiosk notifier for service on and still waited another 15 minutes till she came back I asked for a refill on fries right when we got the food since there was so little and if we waited that long it was going to take a long time! After all this she finally returned and I asked for the fries she asked if I wanted more and I said yes I did! My sister finally was able to order something else even though we all were almost done eating but she was hungry so decided to order knowing how long everything else took !! Why are they called bottomless fries when getting a refill is almost impossible! Finally when the fries and my sisters burger came yes the fries took that long they were raw every time she would drop something off there was no how is everything or is that tasting better or do you want more refills! Very frustrating it was a stop and go stop and go! The sides for my kids we ordered took so long my son feel asleep waiting for them ridiculous! Being a GM of a restaurant I understand how important it is to have great service and how important it is to make sure as a manager you are table touching and making sure your guests are satisfied, though neither of those were a concern tonight! I hate to complain though We came in at 8:40 pm and left at 10:30 pm why? That is too long!! Unless we were caught up having a great time that would be different but having to wait and wait!! Very frustrating I wish I would of been able to complain while I was there but I was beyond tired of being there and I hope this review helps anyone thinking there going to come in and have a meal and go you are wrong you will be there waiting !! I would not visit this location again though the one In chino and Rancho have never disappointed me so if I feel like having a great burger I will try them!!

I just had the worst experience of my life in a restaurant here at red robin. We told the hostess we were going to sit in the bar. We asked a male server if we course sit at a booth and he knotted it was ok. We sat for about 5 minutes which was ok in its self but a waitress was serving another table that came in after us and my husband asked if we were invisible over here. Sort of making a joke. The waitress said that we were not aloud to sit there and that we needed to be seated by a hostess. After explaining that we were not told that. Pretty much in a nut shell I was so embarrassed by the whole seen I left in tears. Good job on customer service. I will never drive so far to be treated badly again.

Just went here for the first time in years at this location. It's still not good. We have to ask for silverware and napkins and that took a long time to get. The fries were hold, hard and not like steak fries at all. My burger was perfect. My wife's burger was under cooked. She wanted it well and it was pink inside. The manager that was on was useless and his staff didn't seem to like him. Awkward.

Usually my food is pretty good but tonight....tonight was something surprising different.  I ordered the Fiery Ghost. It was sooo dry I prayed someone near me knew the hemilac just in case it got stuck in my throat. I've never used so much ketchup in my life just to moisten it up, while taking baby bites, still scared it would get stuck. Now as for fiery....yes it was fiery. My chest was blazing. Now imagine dry, hot, blanketed in ketchup. Now to top it off as I went to take a sip of my water,(because I was thirsty remember?) my daughter kindly pointed out something in my straw! Whaaaa why yes there was something stuck in the inside tip of my straw, it was replaced by the staff when I pointed it out but I could not what so ever get myself to sip. I tried because I was thirsty from this arid burger. My mind just wouldn't get over it.  Noooooo my........ appetite.......was.... officially.......gone. Honestly I was lucky enough to have drank a raspberry cream soda before this unfortunate event, just wish I had saved some of it before my food came. Not my day for Red Robin.
Love this place! The Clucks n' Shrimp is very good! I definitely recommend the Root Beer Float

Every so often I get a huge craving for their bottomless fries so of course you'll find me heading there ASAP. While I am a big fan of Red Robin, I have to say this location does not cut it for me. They are pretty stingy when it comes to fries on weekends; I had to ask for fries twice before my server brought what seemed like less half the usual amount of fries! On a side note this location is NOT dog-friendly making this the only Red Robin location I've visited that does not allow us to sit outside on the patio with our dog - so keep that in mind if you're planning to dine with your furry friend. My overall opinion is, it is just like every other Red Robin but maybe stay clear of busier days.

I haven't been in Red Robin Restaurant in years . Since Rancho Cucamonga. I had a Chucky chicken burgers and my husband had a hamburger across the Th e best burgers we had after long time. We will be back with the kids.

Been coming here for a couple years & always had pretty good service. Tonight, not so much! Went in for an early dinner & it wasn't busy, so I figured we'd get good service.  It started out that way, then as we finished our "bottomless" fries, our waitress didn't show up for awhile.. so we were patient & waited quite awhile.  Finally saw her at the bar, socializing with the bartender so I walked over there & asked for more fries.  Nobody should have to do that, especially if you're going to advertise bottomless fries! Here's where the fun begins: Got the bill, paid cash for it, waitress returns with my change.   I count my change which turned out to be $5 short.  I flag her down & tell her she short changed me.  She looks at all the bills laid out & IMMEDIATELY says "Oh, I forgot to include $5!"  So she opens her change purse & hands me a $5 bill.  NO hesitation whatsoever, of how much she short changed me.  What does that mean?!   She obviously knew exactly how much she short changed/STOLE !!   I gave it back to her well that's your tip. But as we were leaving, I REALLY wish I had not given her that much.  I was just feeling generous I guess, & a food coma coming on. Moral of the story: BE SURE to count your change & beware of waitresses such as ours..(Diane). Not only is she a dishonest waitress, but an awful actress at that.  She made it way too obvious that she "forgot/stole" money from me.  I understand it was only $5, but it's the principle. Bad. Very bad service IMO... Won't be coming back to this place for awhile!!!

3.5 stars This is the location I come to and sometimes it's great and on point and other times service and food just ain't cutting it.  This place gets super crowded, but the wait is not that bad, considering the amount of people who come here.  I came here for dinner to receive my free birthday burger, since today is my bday. The girl taking the names down was very friendly along with the girl who sat us down. Our waiter was also nice. Service was good and so was the food.  I think I've tried all the burgers from here. Most of the time everything is yummy. I also like the freckled lemonade and root beer float. For the most part the food in general is good. Many options to choose from.  Those damn machines on the table are more of a headache then anything. There is always an issue when I use one.  The waiters came and sang Happy Birthday and gave me a free dessert. Everyone seemed friendly. Good experience today, even though our towering onion rings never made it to our table. It's that damn machine, I tell ya.

Banzai Burger...nuff said.  I like crafted burgers but hate places where the burgers come out so huge and messy that you can't eat them the right way and have to use utensils (for a burger!). This place is a nice medium. They have a good selection of burger options on the menu and you can alter them to your liking. They aren't ginormous so you can still eat them like a proper burger. Their steak fries are so good with their own season salt! So in my opinion, if you're gonna cheat on your diet. Do it right and come here for great burgers and bottomless fries.
Good food. Best hot wings. Best Bar service and the best happy hour!!! Ask Diane to make you a Michelada! The best!!!

Came here with one of my work buddies. We ordered  couple beers and I order a burger with chili cheese fries. The burger was okay but the chili fries was horrible. Also tried the fish and chip and thought is was just okay.

Sucks. 20 minutes to get a cup of coffee. Manager made every excuse and basically blamed us for the crappy service we got. The bills were wrong. Took 20 mins to get our bills fixed. Then 15 mins to pay the bill and get our cards back. I won't come back. Their new inside decor doesn't hide the flaws in service.

I'm not from around here, but my boyfriend and I decided to stop and eat here. It's a Saturday night around dinner time so it was obviously super busy, but we got seated within 15-20 minutes and our server was over to help us immediately and our food came way quicker than I expected, and was delicious. Excellent service :)
The servers were excellent, the food was great!  We had a party of 35 people and we were seated and served within 15 min!

I've been to Red Robin, but I've never been to this location until this visit. Parking is ample as it is adjacent to big name stores in the same plaza like Target and Barnes and Noble Bookstores. Service was good for dinner time. The burgers were okay.. nothing too special. They served us cold fries at the beginning and that was unappetizing, but to make up for it, they brought us a fresh plate of new ones. Overall experience: 3/5

*Overall 3.5 Stars* My girl really wanted to bring me here, so I agreed because it's wise to keep the people you care about happy.  We started with some craft beers, Including the elusive Dale Ale in the tall boy can.  We also ordered the new summertime burgers.  They were really good, but at $13.99 each it really seemed outrageous.  They don't put the prices for the seasonal burgers on the menu so the shock was when the bill came.  The bottomless fries have suffered in quality over the years.

I hadn't been to Red Robin in years, but came here with my sister and a friend last Monday. The bottomless steak fries don't excite me but a good burger does. I had a burger which had blue cheese on it and onion rings instead of the fries.   I could hardly taste the blue cheese for the chipotle aioli.  The burger was ok but I don't think I would order it again.  The onion rings were good.  The server could have been more attentive.  I had asked for a refill on my diet coke and had to remind her about it three times

This red robin is great. I've actually never been to a bad one. This one has good service and good food. The drink menu is also pretty decent.  I've tried many things off the menu and it's never disappointing. My favorite lately has been the salads. My kids always love their choices and I like the healthy options, like the grilled chicken with your choice of fruit or vegetables. They also like that they can get balloons here. They always have the nutrition info at the table (which I love).  This location is very busy on Friday and Saturday nights. Other than that, a great family place!

Came into Red Robin on St. Patty's day and was amazed! The atmosphere was electric, my zen was feeling A+ I ordered the Big Turbo, a delicious choice, and as you can see I had a green beer in celebration of the holiday! A great way to spend my St. Patrick's day! P.S. I told the waiter it was my friends birthday and he believed it lol how gullible

Was very disappointed in the service on a tuesday night! Our food sat in the window soo long, I ordered a salad and it was even yuckie. My lettuce was all wilted. The servers walk so slowly like they hate their job and wish they werent there! Part of Our order came out wrong so those people had to wait even longer for their food! I know the rush must have caught them off guard for a tuesday but man o man!

I always have really good service at this Red Robin. Thank you so much for actually having gluten free buns and fries, it's such a treat to be able to have a hamburger and cider out with my friends instead of having to go bunless as is the case at most other places. Everyone is always really careful about my order and I definitely appreciate it. The bacon cheeseburger is my go to and it's super delicious!

Hadn't been here since they gave it a spruce - it used to be much better. The menu still has great options, but their beer selection left something to be desired, my burger came out cold, and so did the soups at the table. Nothing was really great. The server was cool though!

We went in for our one year anniversary and couldn't be happier. My husband called to see if they took reservations since they are always busy and they went above and beyond from that moment. As soon as we walked in, we were greeted with smiles and congratulations. When we sat down, our waitress was very attentive and always had a smile. When we were finishing, Miguel brought us some dessert and a card signed by the staff congratulating us. By far, this was the absolute best experience I have ever had anywhere!  Thank you to everyone there!!
We come for dinner to Red Robin about twice a month. Most defiantly our favorite burger place! Everyone is always great and very friendly. Today Kelly helped us and she was awesome.
Perfect for beers and burgers. Good that they have a lot of substitutes. I always get broccoli instead of fries and my burger wrapped in lettuce

My daughter always says "Not Red Robin." But my wife loves the place. Yes, we eat there frequently. She orders a turkey burger protein wrap. Which means they wrap the turkey patty in either romaine or green leaf lettuce. Every time that I've voiced a concern they addressed it promptly. For myself, I would like to see them serve a thicker clam chowder. Theirs is too liquidity. It's ok, but there aren't enough clams. Thx!

Cleanliness 4 Cost 4 Cuisine 4 Customer service 5 Great burger restaurant. I ordered the chicken teriyaki sand which. It tastes pretty good but it was kind of small. They have unlimited fries so it makes the price worth it. I'd recommend.

Service is horrible. Staff all seems to hate their jobs. Walked in at 9:30pm, was told it'd be 20min. That's fine. Friday night. A crowd of 7!comes in 7 minutes later. Now they're good 45 min wAit. They sit down, 5 minutes later the. Seat them. A party of 7 before a party if 3. BOTTOMLESS FRIES are all you can eat. Do ask for more. She'll bring you 3 at most.

I am very upset and dishearten by the extremely poor service we received at your restaurant. We arrived at 5:30 and waited to be seated. The hostess stated our wait would be 20 to 30 minutes. At 6:15 I went up to ask how much longer it would be. The hostess stated that there was one other family in front of us and they were already going to be seated, so we should be next. As we sat and waited another 15 minutes we witnessed 2 other parties get seated in front of us. I went back up to ask why we have not been seated. She then looked to the manager and said let me have him take care of it right away. She then turned back to me and said she thought we were already seated. The manager came back and unapologetically said that we would need to wait another 15 to 20 minutes before we could be seated. Upset I turned to my family and said lets just go. As we walked out I turned to go back in and witnessed the hostess laughing saying "oh well", I asked to speak to the manager and he was standing next to her. I told him that I was very disappointed, and that I would ensure I notified someone of their lack of professionalism and empathy. The manager did not seem to care nor did the hostess. My family and I eat at Red Robin 2 or 3 times a month, typically in Rancho Cucamonga, this was our first poor experience. I always believed Red Robin set a high standard for quality food and service, but I guess when you have the wrong people representing your company that can easily change your perspective. I truly hope these two individuals are retrained in how to properly provide they quality service your establishment is known for. I also hope your revisit your choice for manager because it seemed as though he completely lacked the fundamental understanding for customer service. I would not recommend eating at the Redland location.

My husband and I frequent this restaurant often.  The service has always been good.  The food is also delicious.  I like that there is a variety of burgers to choose from.  There's never been a long wait to be seated or to get our food.  I usually stick to ordering a simple burger, which has a lot of flavor and don't really need extras on top.  My husband and I would split the onion ring towers, which is always more than enough for two people.  I really like their freckled strawberry lemonade, with real strawberries in it.   This is our go to burger place if we want something more than just fast food.

Went for lunch ordered the Cobb salad and was very disappointed the chicken was like rubber. There was not much flavor for a 12 dollar salad the service was good but my wife and I have noticed over the last couple years the quality of the food has dropped. Very corporate now a days won't be going back.

I was very disappointed today when after a long time out running errands, I decided to treat my sons out to lunch for good behavior. Always having been a fan of Red Robin, I decided to visit the Redlands location. Upon entering there was one woman in front of us who was about to be seated, she declined as she was waiting for her company. The young woman who was ready to seat the other patron coldly asked me "How many?" and I replied three. She looked irritated and didn't say another word, but instead joined the two other young ladies (who hadn't acknowledged or even smiled at us) behind the front desk. All who had their backs turned and talking softly amongst themselves. After a little time of waiting, I decided that that level of disrespect and poor customer service was not worthy of my patronage. So instead I took the little ones to a busy Denny's (not a favorite restaurant) where I was greeted by not only the lady behind the front desk, but by a server nearby. I ended up paying half of what I would have at Red Robin for good food and received three times the service. Customer service although not the end all be all is still a key factor in satisfaction and this time someone deserving received their 25%.

Burgers are great! Unlimited fries are the best! And LOVE the drinks too! Although some of the drinks may not be refillable but at least they are delicious. My only problem is that I can't decide which burger to choose from because they all look too good. Overall, I am satisfied with the service and will come back someday.

I have been a fan for a longtime.. But recently had a really bad experience in service with a specific server.. I went there with 10 people for my son's 6th birthday. After we ordered eight of the people received there food and my two young children did not. In fact they forgot their order all together. I had to go up and track down a manager as our server was no where to be found. On top of that my burger was incorrect and took 15 minutes for myself and my kids to receive our food.  After the Manager and I spoke the server continued to provide crappy service.. The Manager was awesome at trying to make it right and that was very cool. But when I return I will make sure that this server will not serve me...

Went there yesterday with a friend, and it was overall a very enjoyable experience. It didn't take long for my food to come out and the place was packed for lunch time. Our waitress was very friendly and very attentive. My food was awesome and tasted better then I remember! I definitely think the service was great being that it was so packed.

I love their whiskey river bbq burger. I get every time I go to Red Robin. This is the only Red Robin I have ever dined at and it's good. It's not the best hamburger I have ever had in the world, but the menu is affordable and the atmosphere is nice. A major plus if you have children!  We just dined there last week and it was packed, but the staff was very organized and we didn't mind waiting. The manager, Chad, was very friendly and professional and made sure we were taken care of throughout our meal. A+

Good place, very busy at times. The food here I rate a 3.5-4 kind of a hit and miss. The customer service is good had a issue with my drink they gave me another one for free. Went there today for my sons birthday despite being busy they still made time to sing to him. All in all I would recommend.

Highly disappointed with this location.  Service was slow when the restaurant was about 70% capacity.  I have been to many locations, and I cannot believe how long our food took compared to our regular location when it is packed.  The fact that the waitress didn't sing happy birthday was unexpected, disappointing, and sad.  Good thing I am from northern CA and not from around here.  To boot, no balloons at this location. I can only hope they are not racists since we are not white like most of the patrons. Otherwise, food was good.

Came here for my son's birthday. They open at 11am we arrived at 1145. My son ordered the Marco pollo sandwich with fries which he said is amazing. I ordered the bbq chicken sandwich was was fantastic. The food came out fast and fresh. Didn't have a problem with nothing.

My wife and I have been coming to this Red Robin for years. We've always enjoyed our meals here, but this time something had definitely changed. The appetizer and meal portions were smaller than before, and the food was only slightly warm, as if it had been sitting awhile. I can see this maybe happening during a rush hour or something, but we were practically by ourselves today. I like our server, but she seemed really distracted. She had asked if I wanted malt vinegar with my fish and chips, and after I answered in the affirmative, she walked away, seemingly forgetting what she had asked me. I reminded our server about the malt vinegar a few minutes later and she immediately produced it from a work station that was only a foot or two away from our table...What's up with that?

I was told my wait time was 20min and even got a text message confirming this. I understand these are only estimates, however, its been 1 hr and I'm still waiting. This just ruined my entire experience.
This is our favorite place! Family friendly, delicious food, and the service is always SPECTACULAR. Even on a busy Saturday night, the staff is courteous and kind. Very impressive!

Always liked red robin!  This location is decent, lots of seating and bar seating as well.  They have typical menu with lots of options and beer/wine/wells.  The bar is usually faster seating too.  The wait staff has always been great and friendly.  Love their checkout kiosk on each table so its fast and easy when you're read to go.  Lots of parking too.  You can even go online and put your name on the wait list as well.
Me and my family love to come hear and partake in the Clucks and fries meal.... So good and hits the spot every time.
Food was good but the wait time is not. They gave us an estimated wait time of 40 minutes and called us after 56 minutes.

Came here with my family, we where a party of six and had the family dog with us. Parents suggested we leave the dog in the car with the windows down but before they did that, I asked a host if we could be sat in the corner of the patio and the dog be with us instead of a hot car. He was very friendly and allowed the dog to be with us! We're thankful for the friendly and fast service and the doggo thanks you too!
Still pretty good, I recommend  the avo Cabo salad, it's HUGE & delicious. My friend loves the grown up macaroni. Bottomless fries are ok, but better if you ask for them crispy

I've been going to Red Robin for years, this place is great! I usually get the family some zucchini and mozzarella sticks to kick things off, followed up with their bleu ribbon burger and endless fries. Changed it up recently and started getting their fish and chips, which do not disappoint. Get the royalty rewards and get your 10th burger or sand which free..

Management needs to step up. We went for some tavern burgers and found it was a mistake to wash up beforehand. All our menu's were sticky like they haven't been cleaned in months. Paid for our sodas and left . what a dump! 1 star for service
Top notch service ever! Hats off to the chef he knows how to cook finally someone know how usually have to send it back or just eat it.

My mom was visiting which was a special occasion for my family and I. We decided to go to Red Robin since we had so many positive visits in the past and we really enjoy their food. This visit was just ok. The service was ok nothing outstanding and the food was so so as well. My tortilla soup was not the greatest. I like chili's better. My mom's grilled fish meal was excessively salted. At first, I thought she was just complaining so I tried a shrimp and ohh noo!! It was like throwing a handful of salt in your mouth. When she let the server know, the server said oh I'm sorry... They're pretty easy to Peel off though aren't they? She meant the breading...My mom kindly nodded yes and did not touch her plate. I was disappointed in that. I'm sure out next experience will be a better one as we've never had an issue before. We spent nearly $100 this trip, the restroom was an absolute mess too. I informed the manager on the way out. Hopefully they tended to that slippery wet floor. Not good or safe for customers.

It's always pretty good here the food is excellent and so is the customer service thought I would come back though like always I suppose although I wish it would be a little more on the rewards program for regular customers like myself
The service is always great every single time I come. The food is delicious, I love coming to dinner with my family here. I'm a rewards member & I love it!

Horrible Horrible Horrible service. Once waitress took our order she never returned. Never filled up our drinks.Never asked if we wanted more fries. Never mentioned how to pay our bill. Other waitresses and managers walked past our table and nobody bothered to ask us if we needed anything. The light was clearly  flashing on our order tablet and still it was like we were not even sitting there. What an awful lunch experience!!!

Fries were stale and cold.  I ordered shrimp and chicken strips.  The shrimp was soggy and everything was served room temperature.  We ordered more fries hoping for a better batch but they were stale and cold too.  However, the service was friendly and attentive.

As a member, you get the 10th burger free. You also get other deals through email. I just got a free milk shake! In October, I believe it was tavern Tuesday's and all I get are taverns! :) There are always little deals that draw me back in here or maybe it's just the burgers itself. We always go straight to the bar area to eat to avoid the wait and receive faster service. The servers are great. I'm not sure I've had one bad experience.  What's great about this place is that there are no added hormones in their meat and they have vegetarian options too! AND gluten free! There are a good amount of ways to change up your meal to how you want them. I get a side of bottomless broccoli instead of bottomless fries and sometimes I get a lettuce wrap instead of a hamburger bun. My husband gets bottomless side salad.

Brittany and Joseph were our servers. We had a group of four of us. Both servers went above and beyond to answer our questions and help get us the food we wanted. We weren't crowded and they didn't loom over us,  but somehow they knew exactly when we needed extra napkins, alter/add to our orders, or refills. They even helped me with the table bill paying machine that i was struggling to use. I only wish i had more money to tip bigger.  Oh, and the chicken wings were better than buffalo wild wings and wing stop. I was impressed by everyone.   This also was a Friday night visit,  so it was busy. If service is always that good, or even somewhat close,  i would easily highly recommend eating there often. I wish i could give more stars.  Thanks again,  Brittany and Joseph.

We had the wedgie burger.  Bacon, avocado mash,. Lettuce wrap.  It was awesome. I gave it a 5* then went to the ladies room. The one stall available had a broken toilet paper holder. The other one was dirty.

I'm giving two stars because my daughter said she actually liked her food but the moment we arrived till the moment we left this experience was horrible! My family and I usually like eating at red robin but not anymore thanks to the staff that just stared at us until I started walking in to seat myself that someone wanted to help us then our waitress needed a lot more training and I understand it gets busy but we went during one of the slowest times when not nearly enough people were there to make the entire service bad and our food was cold n tasted stale. Red Robin is definitely off our list!

I was there for the first time ever to get my 'Birthday Burger' - The reason I did not rate this restaurant a 5 star is simply due to the fact we've been inside the establishment but was there for a take out, but despite that fact I can state with authority that the food was AWESOME! One of (if not the best) hamburgers I have ever had, The atmosphere inside seems really cool (good tunes on the radio inside). It was clean, smelled delicious, and the hostess (sorry I didn't get her name) was a total doll- she was sweet, courteous to my MANY questions, and she definitely made us (wife and I) feel comfortable.  I highly recommend this place..... be forewarned though the prices are, shall I say, a bit on the expensive side but if even half the food is as good as the burger I ate was, well then it's worth it. Gourmet is putting it mildly. Keep up the fine job folks!!

Poor service ! Will not go back unless I'm dragged back . They dint cook are meat and it was cold like it came out of the freezer. Than threw  a bunch of dressing on it and served it to us. Don't trust that place.

Went last week and my fries were cold. Really disappointing because I've been going to this Red Robin for years and they usually have it together but I guess they're taking a decline in quality. Like come on guys how about you lower the temp on your boiling hot sink water and increase the temp on the fries. Thanks.  Wings are AMAZING. My only issue is I'm not a fan of the chips they serve with them like what weirdo in corporate came up with that? Wings and bootleg Lays ... Eh.  Overall this Red Robin is nice, food is usually good and when you're done you can roam around to all the different stores which is nice.

I got their Burnin' love burger with onion rings.. and I gotta say that I'm disappointed. Oh it tastes good.. but I thought it'd be spicy when I read "jalapeno coins" in the menu description. What came out was unexpected. The only jalapeno I saw and taste was the whole jalapeno stacked on top of the bun. The supposed-jalapeno coin has red pepper instead, and since salsa, chipotle aioli and pepper jack cheese aren't even spicy, it's no "burnin" love anymore. I dare to say Carl's jr's jalapeno burger is wayyyy spicier than this.. and half the price of this one too. Three stars because of the nicely done onion rings, good service (albeit clumsy.. the server dropped our fries twice -_-) and no more 18% gratuity for party over 8 (yes, it's the law now.. yet some places still put 18% gratuity fee. FYI we did leave tips, though we weren't that generous cuz the fries were dropped on top of my friends' phones. Twice.)
This was our first time at this location..it was crowded on a Saturday afternoon  we had to wait 30min to get a table..the food was good and so was the service.

I have been going to this location since it opened. This last visit I ordered a patty melt and a monster chocolate malt. Monster used to mean that it was basically two servings so we could share. Not anymore. There was only a tiny amount in the tin. The patty melt didn't have melted cheese, and the fries were soggy. Disappointed. Service was better than usual, so I will give 3 stars.

Me and my family visited for the first time Red Robin restaurant a choice of my son, we live in Redlands and we come at least two or three times a week to this shopping center and never stopped to eat here. When we walk in my son went to put our name down and the wait was really good we waited the most 7mins after that we got sited and the waitress was Natalie she right away came to greet us and ask us what kind of drinks we want it too we order and she immediately brought us out drinks, then she ask us to if we were ready to order, we were so we starting to order. I told her it was our first time and Natalie with a smile welcome us and that it was her pleasure to help us. We ordered and out food was served nice and hot and fresh, the only thing she missed to bring us was an appetizer that we order the onion rings, but she immediately apologize and told us that it would come as soon as possible. Then within no time she brought the onion rings and told us she would removed them from our check. It was really nice of her to do that. One of the things I really like about this restaurant was the service she came at least 6 times to ask us if we were doing fine, my son want it more mandarines and she said she could bring him more. All my family was so happy and pleased with the service and food. We would definitely would come back and enjoyed the food here. Thank you to Red Robin restaurant.

Food portions were very small. Very disappointed that my wife had two small pieces of chicken and six small pieces of shrimp for 12.99.  I had a bacon hamburger and the burger was very thin and small and the bun was huge. I do not recommend dinner here at this restaurant.  I was a big fan in the past but not anymore.

I recently came here because my boyfriend and I have been craving burgers for weeks, so we were really excited to stuff our faces.... We would've been better off going to Denny's... I was very disappointed with the service we revived, to start off with we signed in for a party of two.... after a 30 min wait we had found out we weren't even registered on their new "iPad wait list" even though I clearly got a txt back message saying I was set on it. After wards when we finally got sat down.... we ordered two entrees and an appetizer.... After waiting around 20 minutes and the appetizer never showing up I had finally asked about it and apparently a different waitress had given it out to a different table...... By this time we were starving and didn't really care for it anymore... I had asked them to cancel it since our food was already here.... When I revived my burger the bun was soggy and so was the fries..... also cold... Overall bad experience, I'm not sure if they were maybe just having an off day. But I will not be quick to come back to this same location, I was truly expecting much more... I've been to the Rancho Cucamonga location and it was amazing service however it is about 20 min away from me but I much rather waste more of my time and gas to have an enjoyable dining experience.

me and my wife went there she insisted she wanted to try the food  the food was ok but let me tell you I order the bacon guacamole burger  I never found the guacamole  I Don think the put guacamole  not even 1 0z come on guys is a guacamole bacon burger    there was like a spread of green stuff so little and the bacon was soft not even crispy we won't be coming back I only give it 3 stars cause the service was good
Service was good, food was okay, price was fair, place was congested. Good place to take kids because they have several kids options.
Red robin is good all around highlight is there Jamaica jerk sandwich and there bottomless fires :)

My girlfriend and I have been waiting at red robin for 35 minutes on a half sandwich and a soup for me, and a chicken salad for her. Waiters continue to work around us as if we don't exist trying not to make eye contact as they serve guests food who just arrived directly next to us. I'm not pleased and won't be returning.
We came on a Sunday night and we got terrible service. Our waiter was Angie and she was very rude and had smart comments all night and sometimes even forgot our order.

While waiting for my mouth to heal after getting my tooth drilled, crowned, root canaled, numbed and pulled. It seems like every other commercial  was Red Robin's  referring to their bottomless fries.  I never cared for Red Robin prior to this. I had nothing against them, it was just that if I wanted a burger I would go else where. I didn't even know that it was Red Robin Gourmet Burgers. I just knew them as Red Robin. But when you can only drink soup for 3 1/2 weeks and the same commercial keeps telling you to eat their fries, your willpower is shot. Once my doctor said you can "probably" eat a burger now.... probably was good enough for me! I was off to Red Robin!! Granted I was still sore and my mouth hadn't fully healed but I was dying to eat something other than soup and protein shakes. They were advertizing the Berserker Burger because of the new Wolverine movie and I decided to get that. My server was nice and cute. I wish I knew her name. It sounded middle eastern. or Indian. She took care of me and I think she was even the bartender that day.  The burger was good. I couldn't enjoy it like I wanted because my mouth decide that "probably" wasn't enough and I got sore fast. Also, chewing on the opposite side that you normally chew on is like using your left hand if you are right handed. (Or right hand if you are left handed for you south paws). it isn't something you think about until you have too... I couldn't even enjoy the bottomless fries. :( I have to go back to redeem my mouth, and of course give them another chance. it isn't their fault my mouth was hurt. The drink I ordered was good though. It was a Coor Light can with alcohol and Coors in it. A neat concept. Will have to try the other version.

Mmmmm garlic french fries & ranch! They have some of the best ranch.Sometimes the french fries are not that fresh.. Hit & miss but they're good and you can ask for fresh ones I guess if you feel they aren't fresh enough.

Came here on Sunday afternoon, it was packed but we got seated pretty quick. We had a group of six do that was impressive.  I got the Pig Out cheeseburger. I wasn't that impressed. It was smaller then a regular Red Robin burger and tasted like a basic bacon cheeseburger. I won't be getting that next time.
Love the endless fries. I got sweet potato fries. I also love all different selections of aiolis. I got the Hercules burger. It was good. I kinda wish their burgers were juicier and thicker though.

The three stars are for service. Went in Sunday the 28th. My daughters fries were stone cold, my clam chowder soup still had cold lumps of something. My salad was flavorless, my sons chicken was dry. The service was good.

Came into this establishment on our way back from Running Springs and was craving a delicious burger and fries.  There was a minimal wait time, about 10 minutes and was seated in the bar.  Ordered the usual Whiskey River Burger without tomato and a water with lemon.  Order came with tomato and meat was over cooked so it was dry. I also never got the side of lemon requested with my water until just before we were served...overall service was okay, not the best we've had at other Red Robin establishments.

I've done to go here a couple times for lunch and Natalie took care of me both times. She was so friendly and made sure I had everything I needed.  I love to substitute the salad for the fries and they'll give you an additional one if you ask, just like they would fries. I also have a little bit of an obsession with their ranch!

On this specific visit, we showed up the day after Christmas around 430PM (a Saturday) to have dinner as a party of 10. They told us it would be 20 to 30 minutes for our table to be ready because of the size of our group. Fifty minutes later we were seated at the table. It took a while to be attended to by our waitress, but once she showed up, she did quite well by our large group. I'm not going to bother describing the meals that were ordered, but suffice it to say that it was basic burgers and fries and a salad or two. Overall, I would likely never choose to come here short of my burger being free. This location is as good as any of the Red Robins that I've been to, I'm just not impressed by the chain. I think Five Guys and In N Out offer better burgers than this chain does and would personally rather eat at either of those restaurants instead. If you prefer something more than meat and cheese for your burgers, then Red Robin may be a better fit for you, but it isn't a good fit for me.

Really enjoyed our experience here last night. When you're craving a burger, it really hits the spot. I ordered the Whiskey River BBQ Burger which was really good, though it could have used a bit more mayo (picture included though it was almost gone by the time I remembered to take one!). Husband ordered the Guacamole Bacon Burger and it was gone in seconds! We also ordered two tall Stellas which were great. The main lacking aspect was the kids meal. The cheeseburger was really really dry. Definitely needed some condiments and needed to not be well done right from the gate. Oddly enough the fries, which I hear so much about, came out room temp instead of freshly hot, but the seasoning salt helped it out a lot. And lastly we ordered dessert, which I definitely would not order again (though that's just based on taste preferences not the item itself). We ordered the Chocolate Fruffles which was basically a cold brownie dipped in dark chocolate, not what my sweet tooth was looking for at all. But if we do go back, I'll be sure to order the Mud Pie which looks great and stick to their burgers!

Food was good nothing crazy. Tasted like a premium version of Burger King it has that same phony charbroiled flavor not like real charbroiled like nicks burgers in Redlands. But for $22 it was a cheap way to get out and have some little fun. Expected more but you get what you pay for. Service was ok had my server light on for at least 5 minutes before anyone walking by noticed to get a water refill.

It's pretty decent.  They have been raising prices quite a bit so it's not the value it used to be but it's still a decent burger from a large chain type place.  To me it's the best option in that plaza.

My wife and little boy come here about every other Friday.  The service is up and down, depending upon the server.  Otherwise, the food is consistently pretty good and our little boy loves the atmosphere.  No big complaints.
More fries please!!!! This gourmet burger joint is outstanding  Always crowded is the double edged sword. It's worth the wait. Outside patio is a big plus.
Great food and salad was delicious! Chicken Enselada was yummy!! Bottomless root beer floats for my kids and the freckled lemonade was amazing!!

I like Red Robin.  It is a fun place to go with friends.  This one is no different.   The Pro's The service here at this place has always been good.  They do a great job at keeping it clean and in good repair.  The food is good and the bottomless fries are great.  Drinks are refilled quickly.   The Con's Small burgers that need the bottomless fries to fill you up.  It can get very noisy at times.

Food was ok. Service usually good in the restaurant area. Service in the bar area is mediocre but terrible if Jen is your waitress. Very sarcastic. Slow service. Fake smile. If I come back I will ask for different server in bar if I get Jen.

I went here for lunch last sunday with my boys. Quite a line at 1pm. We were seated 15min later. A waitress immediately took our drink and meal order. I ordered the promo "wolverine" burger. The kids ordered the mac n' cheese. The food came out pretty fast. The burger was decent. I enjoyed the siracha sauce on it. The presentation is a little different. No longer comes in a basket. I still prefer the bbq burger though. The mac n' cheese is still runny. The good thing is they will guve you free refills on it f your kids want.  All in all, one of my favorite family dining places. The food is decent and service is pretty good.

Great food, great service, love the Royalty program. Been here many times before and felt like it was a training store. Service was poor in the past. Been a awhile since I was back. Glad I did, this visit was awesome !
This is my go to place for to go food. Never ever have issues! Love their rewards card! It's always a nice surprise to get those free items.

My girlfriend had the seafood scatter, it was too much fried stuff for her. The fish was delicious though! I had the Black and Blue, it was awesome ! Yummy Fries tasted perfect with the blue cheese sauce!

Great location and overall good customer service. Their burgers have consistently tasted great although their garlic fries were a bit greasy for my taste. As with many other chain restaurants, the menu is extensive and options are plentiful to suit your tastes. I wouldn't say their food is the healthiest around, but when you're in the mood for a good burger, this Red Robin won't disappoint.  The service i've experienced was quick and attentive.
