One young lady I didn't particularly care for because her tone was fairly snooty when I asked a question, however I can't hate on the rest of the hard working staff at the location. If you're in the Redlands area and want a great burger (without going to Five Guys) go here... you won't be disappointed.

Worst Red Robin I've ever been to. I normally get a fiery ghost tavern double with 1 veggie patty instead of the meat patties, but the waiter said they he would have to charge me for the more expensive one with the bigger patty. Ummm no I'm not asking for a bigger patty. I just want a veggie patty instead of two small meat patties is that so hard? The waiter went and asked the manager and apparently the manager refused to allow this and demanded to charge me $2 more for extra meat that I wasn't even getting. I was beyond livid and I can assure you I will NEVER come back to this location again. The restaurant was clean and there was no wait, but the host Lionel was very rude because he was asking personal questions on why we were here and was expressing his sexual orientation to my boyfriend. Such a terrible red robin. DO NOT COME HERE!!! Just sayin

I'm glad Red Robin pays attention to their reviews. Gave this place another shot and it was so much better. I even went on a busy Friday night again and the service was so much better. I know things aren't always perfect, but it's great to know that things have improved. Also, opted for the sweet potato fries this time. Much better than the garlic fries.

Red Robins.. oh yeah.. Came here for lunch.  Bottomless fries with free sauces and my Colossus burger!! The service and food was great!! The burger had some pinkness in the middle.. Cooked perfectly the way I ordered it.  Been to the Redlands before, service there are prompt, friendly, and right on.  Our waitress was very friendly telling us about the different types of burgers and letting us know beside burgers there are salad and other entrees.  Overall I'm an happy camper.. will return next time...

Came in with my girlfriend on a weekday night.  She ordered a burger and I ordered the fish and chips. My order of fish and chips came out cold.  They said they would remake it and the second order came out cold as well.  I'm not talking about the food not being hot enough, I'm talking about cold to the touch.  You would think they would check to ensure I wouldn't be biting into undercooked fish.  That's expecting too much of these clowns. The fries they gave us were stale.  When asked for more, it took 2 tries on a slow night to get our refill of fries.  Our drinks were never refilled. They also charge for jalepenos.  What year is this? I emailed corporate and they said they would contact me.  After I contacted them 2 additional times, their silence made it clear they don't give a flying duck.  In the spirit of Ron Burgundy's immortal words, "go fry yourself Red Robin." If you're gonna eat here I feel bad for you son, there are many good burger places but this Red Robin ain't one.

I read the review below where the waitress gave $5 less in change than the customer was due.  Yesterday, my waitress gave me $10 too much and of course she thanked me for pointing it out.   We've enjoyed eating here many times.  Yesterday I ordered two milkshakes to go - a regular and a Monster.  After a considerable wait the milkshakes were delivered, both in what were the same sized cups, what I would consider a regular (not large) cup.  Upon questioning, the waitress confirmed one was regular and one was Monster, but she said the Monster had more in it.  The regular was $3.50 and the Monster! was $5.00.  If you really want what the name implies, I guess you'd have to order 2.  Oh well, it's all in the marketing on their end and I fell for it.

This was my first visit to red robin in Redlands. I have been to many red robin restaurants and this place is the bottom of the list. I went to the bar and took a seat for what I thought would be quicker service. Found myself getting ignored by the bartender. I figured she was just distracted by the other 3 patrons but after 10 mins of listening to their delightful conversations, I decided I was being ignored. I had to catch a waitress in the dining area to get my second drink and at that point I wasn't  going to attempt to order food. I will try again, hopefully this was just a bad day.

I came here with my coworkers for lunch and it was my second time being there in a very long time. It was surprisingly good. I'm not much of a burger person, but I did enjoy their food. It was simple but very tasty, prices weren't too bad either and good customer service.
Ok place to grab some lunch. Chain restaurant there all pretty much the same. Bill can add up real quick here if your not careful. Tummy ache later is free tho!

Very dissappointed with Red Robin. Ordered Insane Romaine with chicken. The chicken was so nasty with no flavor, it was the previously frozen piece of chicken that is pre cooked with the grill marks on it that you buy in a bag. It was so compressed, and had a gel taste to it. I talked to the manager and asked if it was frozen pieces, he said yes ( which I already knew by lack of flavor and texture) when we got our tickets he charged me $9 just for the lettuce, and said he took off the chicken. Most reputable restaurants would just comp the plate. This place counts the lettuce leaves when they credit you. We have been customers for years but we will never return to a Red Robin. If you make people happy there are more likely to return.

The Red Robin experience was a disappointment this week. I decided to go for the new signature burger, the Smoke and Pepper burger with fries.  I knew something was up when the burger arrived in around fives minutes from when it was ordered. The menu talked about a hand formed, half pound patty topped with bacon and cheese.  The patty was small, and appeared to be their standard burger fair, not the hand formed patty.  The patty was comparable in size and form to the regular burger my wife ordered.  The bacon was limp and greasy.  The cheese was paper thin.  Given the very short time to get the burger to me, there is no way they could have hand formed the patty and cooked it to order.  I think I got a run of the mill burger that was on the grill before I ordered it. There is just no other explanation.  At $13.99 for this burger, I won't be having it again. Red Robin, you need to re-think your Signature fair.

First of, bartender Ashley is so nice and friendly. I am a fan of Red robin ever since my first time in the bay area. I have never had bad food or bad service there.  I really wanted a Burger today while I was driving home and thought, the best burger I know will be at red robin. I ended up at the one in Redlands and since I was alone, I went to the bar area. It was pretty busy but the bartender came to my table soon as she saw me. I ordered the Banzai burger which was awesome. The service was fast and friendly. The food was great and it was really nice environmenI would say you can't go wrong with lunch at Red Robin ever!!!

I went here on the way home from shopping at the cabazon outlets and got some take-out. We ordered the peppercorn burger and bowl of clam chowder. The place was new and clean and the service was good but it took some time for the order to come out. (20-25 min) The burger was huge and came with their signature fries. The burger was decent but it didn't have much flavor. The sauce was mild even though there was peppercorn sauce. I did like that it was lean and not very greasy at all. The soup wasn't bad especially on a cold winter day but it was too watery. I liked the focaccia bread it came with. Overall, I feel like the menu items are all kid friendly but not a bad place to go if you're craving something simple.

I haven't been to a red robin in over six years. & today I finally went. ordered a red tavern double & sprite. my brother got some boca burger & their root beer float. my sister got a bleu ribbon. so we had the unlimited fries & broccoli, boy was the food good. great service! Gemma was our server, she was super nice!

Food was very good, servers are nice and bring drinks quickly, but when burger came out, with endless fries, I ate the burger and fries and there was some time between when they checked on me to see if I needed some more. By the second round of fries came, I ate a few and was full because they took too long to bring them.

YUMMM!!! That's their slogan for a reason! I love going to different Red Robins to see all the different settings, though they're all pretty similar.  This one is a little smaller than most I've been to. There is way less space to walk even though there's plenty of seating perfect for big groups and a small date. Top Burger Recommendations: Whiskey BBQ Burger && Quac Bacon Burger Surprisingly their FISH & CHIPS are a pretty safe bet here at RR. They give you a lot, compared to most restaurants, 4 giant fried pieces of cod and ENDLESS FRIES!!! It's filling for me and I often have to share. If you wan an appetizer, I'd recommend getting a single/double combo of stuff found on the front of their menu. This stuff will always be cheaper and they won't completely fill you up before your meal. Safer bet, even if there are a lot of people in your group. Only BAD thing was that our waitress hovered too much. She checked on us every 2 minutes and barely let us eat.  I think its great to provide customers with great and friendly service, but it was TOO much. It was hard to enjoy our meal, as well as our conversation.   For those who are fans just like my boyfriend... YES they serve DR. PEPPER!!

All in all a good dining experience. We were a bit nervous to touch the bar and nutritional menu because we could see the previous diners greasy finger prints. Our dinner was good. Food tasted good. And who doesn't love bottomless fries?? First portion of fries could have been hotter but the following ones were hot. The server said that today was an unusual monday. (It was packed!) As our meal came to an end, we stared boxing up our leftovers to find a scary scene under the wax paper separating our fries from the red plastic basket. Not only was it greasy, it has ketchup or bbq sauce all over it. We notified our server, who alerted the manager. Obviously it was not her fault but she immediately apologized. The manager was really concerned about the basket and informed us that they get washed after every use. He, very generously, gave us a 25% discount off the entire check. But, yes, we will be back. I can't help but follow red Robin with yummmm. And bottomless fries??

I'm not a big fan of hamburgers but I am a big fan of Red Robin. The onion rings are as good as onion rings get. The BLTA croissant is also very good and the french dip is better than most. The service is always good and the prices are reasonable. This restaurant is kid friendly so if you're easily annoyed by loud and rowdy behavior, this is not your place. On a side note, I don't get this. "Would be a five but its a chain." There is nothing inherently good or bad about chains and/or family-owned businesses. I don't get this. It's illogical. So if food in mediocre at a family-owned single location restaurant, I'm supposed to eat there instead of the chain with better food? Sorry, but that's just dumb. Edit: have to take away a star because you can't get a burger that isn't pink on the inside. Order medium and I get rare. Order well done and I get rare. Come on guys. Pink ground beef is not cool.

Ok, Day three since my horrible treatment by the Waitress in the bar here.  I have spoken to the Manager Chad, the District Manager Andy and tried to reach his boss to day with no response yet.  All they have done is offer free stuff, I don't want free stuff, that is not what this is about. They have offered us a $100 gift card, funny, I drop $200.00 per week at Sushi, leave a $60.00 tip, $100 is not worth the pain my wife will go though to walk in that place again while that waitress still works there! So this is not about free food, This is about how a person in the Hospitality Field treated a customer with such disrespect and contempt that they made one of the parties so upset that they went home and got ill!!  She laughed at us, she called us a name and said Buh Bye (like Felicia) to us with her back turned to us as she walked away and mocked us.  All because we accidentally sat ourselves at the Bar without a Hostess.  We did not realize that on this day, at this bar, anything was different from every restaurant bar (even this one) we have ever gone to. If you read the other reviews here you will see that several say " We go straight to the bar area to eat to avoid the wait", but when we did it this a waitress treated us like homeless filth. And she was going to ignore us for seating ourselves until a got her attention then she punished us and embarrassed us so bad that we wanted to crawl in a hole...  Anyway, Free stuff will not make me come back...  Only the termination of this woman will be acceptable by me.  If you patronized my business and you were treated like this by one of my employees I would fire them the same day!!  No second chance, no pass!!  She should not get one either!!

i hadn't been to a RR in years. went on a friday night with my mom and daughter. service was on point and the food was surprisingly amazing. WE had the spinach dip appetizer (which I get at many places) and it was good. my mom and i shared one of their featured burgers and it was so good! fries were piping hot too. my daughter had the kids mac n cheese with broccoli - good portion and she ate every bite. only complaint would be the broccoli which appeared to have been microwaved. My husband loves burgers so I am looking forward to coming back with him.

The service at this Red Robins is terrible. Our waitress was rude and even rolling her eyes. Not to mention it took her 20 minutes just to come take our order. After that we were waiting for 45 minutes and still no food. We got tired and left. All I have to say is Red Robins better take a good look at who they hire.

Alrighty folks this review and all other future reviews will be about light and fish meals. Bye ribs, steak, tacos, cake and all the other craziness. Red robin is not a place to eat healthy so I ordered water with a lemon slice and a small soup. In the future I will target places that have great healthy offerings and report out on that.

What can I say I really love this place. Every time I come here the waiters/waitresses are really nice and the managers from time to time come and check up on you.  I love coming here because of the unlimited fries/garlic fries that come with your food. The burgers are really good too. I recommend the Burnin' Love Burger, that is mucho love. Try it with their fish if you don't eat meat, it's just as good, if not better. The jalapeño rings, tangy salsa, and spicy Pepper-Jack cheese are just love. When I did eat meat you can taste the pepper crusted meat too. It had a good spice to it.  The Blackened Bayou Burger is good too. If you like spicy stuff, these burgers have a good kick that you'll love, I know I do. I like the burgers more than Islands to be honest.  I had their Bruschetta Chicken Burger but replaced it with fish instead and it's way better than the chicken. I've had it with the chicken and it was kind of bland, having it with fish is much better. The steak sliders are well steak-e. I don't know why I was all "it tastes weird" but it was more texture wise. If your looking for something not huge, you may want to get these, but there are other items you can that taste better. I love their Artic Cod fish & chips. Just the way it's battered and the way it's cooked is good. It's usually a tie between their fish and chips and Claim Jumpers. Don't order the Salmon fish & chips though, my friend had them and I tasted them. It tasted funny. You can try them, but I wouldn't recommend them. The wraps are pretty good, you're looking for something light and healthy go for the wraps. The clam chowder isn't watery and was pretty thick when I ordered it. My friend loves the tortilla and French onion soup. I'm not a fan of either, but they say it's really good. For appetizer I suggest the artichoke dip or the towering onion rings. Although I don't see the point in ordering appetizers here when the entre's are huge and you get unlimited fries. The onion rings when we ordered it for the first time were pretty good. I think it was over cooked though.  They also have a good variety for the kids menu. The mac n cheese is actually good. Cheesy and not the store bought kind either. This is a great place to go with friends for dinner, after work or just want to meet up and hang out. It's a good place for sharing food too! The one drink I do miss that they took out was the Blueberry Pomegranate drink. That was really good! They need to bring it back!
Had a nice lunch today! Service was great and the food was tasty! The Buffalo wings were were my favorite! efinitely eating there again!!

Delicious. Good. Yum. Endless calories but I don't mind... Best Bites: (1) Whiskey River BBQ burger (2) Royal Red Robin burger (3) Banzai Burger (4) Sauteed Shroom For a place that touts itself as gourmet, Red Robin really does have some neat and inspired surprises tucked into each burger. For example, the Royal Red Robin burger is topped with a fried egg, which sounds preposterous but adds an extra layer of delicious, unexpected richness to the burger. The Banzai is another one of my all-time favorites, with teriyaki sauce playing off of a grilled piece of tangy pineapple. The endless fries are also insanely good -- thick, fluffy slices of potato packed with different seasonings and fried till they are crispy golden. Definitely worth the money, just beware -- these burgers are on the heavy/rich side.

I have eaten at a lot of red robins. Some are awesome and some suck. This one was in between. Crappy beer selection and barely warm fries and burger. The fries were pretty sad looking and the burger patty was in two pieces. Staff was okay but you could tell they had no buy in and no "attention to detail". When the staff isn't happy the food suffers and so does customer.

Decided to come here for my birthday. I haven't been here in years. Have to say it's still as great as it's ever been. The first thing I noticed, they didn't have garlic fries listed on the menu. However this was remedied when I inquired about having them (instead of regular fries) with my burger. And if you haven't had their garlic fries, you need to try them. DELISH! The burger variety was unique. I went with the peppercorn burger and was not disappointed. So many different flavors in this burger!! Nuff said. Drinks wise, I was happy too see many old favorites on tap (Guiness, Blue Moon, Hangar 24, etc). Cannot wait to come back for more eats!
stop by Red Robin had their $14 burger which was overcooked and I gotta admit not that good I think Burger King does a better job I'm sorry to say

I called in to place an order and waited 10 minutes before the order was taken. I get there and the receptionist had a very nonchalant attitude. "She" the server will be here later. The server was very friendly but the overall experience with the attitude and wait time left a bad taste in my mouth. The burger was ok.
Totally recommend their Burnin Love, the BESTEST! Their new Banzalo Burger is great!  Awesome new menu. Affordable burgers! Wouldn't eat them everyday tho

Went to red robin on fri night at about 9:30 pm 7 /23/15 couldn't believe all the dang kids in there climbing all over booths and tables you would think its like chuckie cheese, terrible waitress service and dirty tables everywhere as if the buss boys were on strike literally every 3 tables had all kinds of trash on the tables,  there were 4 of us 2 of the burgers came on plates the other two came on a little basket with a paper on it, they can't buss the tables and they can't even serve all the meals on a plate what a joke no more for me, you go to any char broiled burger joint in Redlands you can at least get a plate, they advertise endless fries and they give you like literally a child's portion to start, I ordered a gourmet burger with onion rings it came on the little basket I couldn't even find room to pick it up, so I guess lets just get my hands all dirty with sauce, cmon man
F'ing nasty sat down at the bar and it was so sticky and dirty!!! I used my napkin to wipe down as much as I could... Filthy !!!

Nothing like free to make you like food more. Got my free burger for my birthday and everything was tasty and cooked to perfection! Ask for Chloe she is an amazing server with a great personality! I recommend starting off with a wedge salad it's delicious and the crispy onion straws on it just put it over the top!

the food was pretty good and i imagine it would have been better if it wasn't cold. the service was so terrible,  that alone will keep me from returning. once we had our food, no one bothered to come back to offer any refills on drinks or fries. the waitress only came back to offer dessert and when we declined, she immediately handed over our bill. thanks.

I'm sad to say this location has lost it's spark for me.I came here with my family to redeem my bday burger offer.I don't need a song or anything.I didn't even receive a happy bday or even a complimentary dessert . Our waiter didn't seem interested in serving us .And after waiting a loooong time for the food brought it out two minutes later after we asked about it, like he forgot about it or something.

Red Robin is not my favorite place to eat, but the service at this location was excellent. We had Joann help us out and although the food was just burger and fries, nothing spectacular, she made our dining experience enjoyable. This is a very rare case of service over taste, I'll come back for the mediocre food but stay for the warm hospitality.

We go here often & are usually pleased but last weekend changed my opinion. We had a large group of 18 planning on getting together. I called 4 days in advance to notify them & set up reservations. The manager refused to take down my name saying, "We already have 2 large groups at that time. 5 o clock is very busy for us. You will have to just put your name in and wait your turn". He then hung up on me!  When we got there Saturday at 5 it was busy like usual. We had to wait about 15min. They gave us only 1 waitress. She took our drink order in a timely manor. We all got our drinks pretty quickly except my friend that ordered coffee. She waited until our food came. Usually they will bring you fries after you order your food but not this day. When our food came most of it was correct but one of my friends order was completely wrong. When she told the waitress she apologized saying she would bring the correct food. It never came. My husband split a burger with a friend and they gave him 5, yes only 5 fries! We asked for more 3 times before they came.  Our food was good and far as I know everyone's food was hot. We never got more fries even though we asked several times.  I usually drink water when we go out but because the water is so horrible at this Red Robin I am forced to drink something else. I ordered a Speckled Lemon aid. It was good but went very fast. I asked for a refill 3 times. She finally brought it in a to go cup as we were leaving. My coffee drinking friend never got a coffee refill. One really good thing was she didn't stick us with the usual large group gratuity. We would have spoken to the manager at that point. I will probably go here again as we really do enjoy their food but I will think twice before taking a large group.

This place was good. But, over the last year we have gone there 4 or 5 times and the food is always cold and the orders are wrong often. Management is claims to be aware of the problem but nothing about it.  Why are there 8 reviews that are hidden?

The atmosphere was great. We had to wait about a half hour but they have balloons for kids to be entertained with and some games that really arent for kids but they kept the 2 year old occupied. I think they should have a better system for calling people when their table is ready. They only call out inside and the inside seating area was full. The service was awesome. The server was so pleasant and interacted with the 2 yr old. As for the food, no one at my table was feeling it. We had spaghetti, kid pizza, fries, and the uhhhhh chicken burger that's one of the big items... some kind of bbq or jack daniels or something. They have it in chicken, hamburger, and a wrap. Nothing we ordered was impressive. I'm not sure how much we paid because I didn't see the bill but I think a hamburger/fry meal is about $10-$14. The endless fries are a pretty good deal too. Overall, I wouldn't mind going again if I was going to order one of the hamburgers with a lot of stuff on it, but that's about it. Again, I liked the atmosphere there. The bathroom could use more stalls though...

Food is always good at Red Robin but the service here was horrible!! No refills on drinks no refills on fries and got our appetizer onion ring tower after we got our meal? Been to over 12 locations the service here is almost as bad as the one on McKinley in Corona!!
Food is pretty good. The service is a little slow--we waited about 10 minutes before someone came over. Clucks and Fries were delicious.

I always like going to Red Robin's...I am glad they are growing and the popularity hasn't affected the quality of their food.  Today I came in and had a gourmet cheeseburger, which I promptly upgraded to monster (second patty).  They offer a variety of cheeses for this burger and I opted for provolone.  I also ordered a Hangar 24 Orange Wheat 22 oz.  One of the best meals I've had in a while.  The burger was out in a flash too!  I definitely like this place.  It's very family-oriented but I don't worry about things like that...I'm here for the food.  I am sure there are better burgers but you would be hard-pressed to find one in this area. One more thing...Hangar 24 is a local craft brew brewed in Redlands, CA.  You won't find it readily available (I suggest you get one whenever you get a chance) but Red Robin's always offer local craft brews in their bars, which is a good deal as far as I'm concerned.  If you go to Red Robins, always ask your waiter or waitress for the locals because they are usually not on the menu.  Trust me, these brews are better than what's offered on the menu.

I have been sitting at my table for about 10 minutes without one bite of food and the experience so far is the best I have had anywhere all because of our waitress Ashley.  She has a phenomenal smile that matches her personality.  Very helpful with wonderful suggestions for food and beer.  Appetizers came out quick.  So I'm certain the rest of dinner will be just as great!  Yeah Ashley!

My boyfriend and I walked out of this Red Robin this morning after being seated but never helped after 12 min. We luckily went to Chilis in the JC Penny lot just down Lugonia one block, and had a great experience with the customer service and lunch there. I've been to this location once before and it was slow but at least we were helped. I won't likely ever eat at this Red Robin location again.

I have been coming here and have never had anything bad to say about this place, however today was different. My mother and I had been waiting to be seated while other people who came in after us continued to be seated before us. The hostess looked like they were confused and when I asked why we weren't being seated one of them called my name and sat us in the bar area where I could of just sat in the first place because it's already first come first serve in the bar but I wasn't expecting to be seated in the bar but in the main restaurant. Now, I was already disturbed about the way the hostess handled the beginning of our experience with no friendliness towards us as customers. The bartender and server (Nina) came over and I vented to her about what happened and she apologized for them but her has a person was very professional and kind and she then made our experience very enjoyable while we were there. Thank you Nina for being so kind towards my mother and I. After we were finished with our meal we got up and proceeded to exit the restaurant where none of the hostess said thank you or not even come again. I believe that management needs to have a in service with their hostess to be better greeters towards the customers. Will I go back? Yes of course I would. Our lunch was great thanks again Nina.

They should call this place Red Robin day care. Toddlers  everywhere screaming. Service was slow. took longer to get napkins and ranch than it did to get our entree. They should really separate the families with kids under 6 from the text of the diners. It was tough. lots of screaming. food was good as usual.
My wife's favorite restaurant. Wish we had one closer to where we live though.

All I need to say is--BBQ wrap. Chicken, cheese, ranch dressing, shredded lettuce and tortilla chips wrapped in a delicious spinach tortilla! The service is quick and the employees are nice. They usually just keep the bottomless steak fries coming without having to ask them. The menu items are reasonably priced and the food is good, so I couldn't ask for more. The mud pie is delicious too!

This place is always packed. If you are looking for a good burger, this is your place. They have a huge variety, so there is something for everyone. It is pretty loud inside, which is fine for me but some may not care for. Their servers are always friendly and attentive and the food always comes out hot. They will even give you a free refill on your fries. This is a great place for a big party, or even if you have rowdy kids. Always a good experience at this place.

I have a rule that I never go to chain restaurants.  But for my wife's birthday she wanted to go here for lunch and I obliged.  The food was fine.  I got a gardenburger and they cook it on a separate grill away from the meat, which is nice for us vegetarians.  I will say this...The service was absolutely spectacular.  The food was 3 stars and the service was 5 stars.  Our server Casey was friendly, attentive, and went out of his way to make our dining experience the best.  Will I be back...next year on my wife's birthday.  But if chain restaurants are your thing then this is a good one.

Royal Red Robin Burger. Oh, you want more information? Hmm...  It's a chain restaurant that sells burgers and has a full bar. So if you have a whisky 'n' burger hankering it's the place for you! And it's family oriented, so confusing. But they have a great cheeseburger here and it has a fried egg on top.  Royal Red Robin Burger. So good, so bad! So good... It will love you to death. The bottomless fries don't help either.

Decided to eat with grandma in tow on Tuesday.  The hostess was new and our waiter was new and very pleasant.  The food was mediocre and the menus were all different for our group of 4.  How does that happen?  The two things that were unacceptable was a hair ball in the small basket of forks delivered to our table and the group of 15 that thought they were at a soccer game. I never saw a manager wandering around so I'm guessing they need to step up and make this place worth coming back to.
Good burger place! I don't recommend getting steamed broccoli or any other veggies. They really only know how to do burgers and fries... but they are tasty burgers and fries! Oh yeah, and shakes.
Great diner style burgers, on point every time. I like the original gourmet double medium rare. Never disappoints.

Red Robin is one of those places that I only go once a year.  There's really nothing spectacular going on here although I must say, the service is very good and professional.  The food on the other hand is nothing special.  The whole concept of this restaurant seems to cater to the largest segment of the American population as possible.  It left my experience tonight as perfectly forgettable.  My Burning Love burger tonight was honestly quite bland and freckled lemonade is just Minute Maid lemonade and strawberries: you can get that at Del Taco.  Can't wait to hike over to LA and hit up the Grill Em All truck!

RED ROBIN ROCKS!! My family & I frequent it once a week we all order different burgers, cut them in half & share them. if you haven't had their Prime Chophouse, Blue Ribbon, the Bacon Burger & of course the Burning Love, you haven't tasted the best burgers ever. Oh yeah also their bottomless sweet potato fries & drinks, awesome.  The atmosphere & staff/service are excellent at their job. These people are passionate about their service & quality of food and it shows every time I eat there.

Best place to go for a burger if you want higher quality than In-and-Out.  Good variety of burgers.  Even when they're pretty busy, seating doesn't take a long time.  My wife and I split a burger often and they have no problem with that.  She loves the strawberry lemonade.  Wiskey River BBQ burger is standard and very tasty.  NOT A HEALTHFOOD OPTION.  Only drawback is appetizers... portions are very small for the price.
food here is the same as any chain, the location is nice the service is fast, what else can you ask for from a red robin?
Hated the food and the service was terrible. If your looking for an over crowded restaurant with kids running around unattended than this is the place for you.

The staff and managers are great, they will always help out however they can. The burgers are great! The appetizers are fantastic! There is some noise levels that can be distracting with the set up of the restaurant, but that is probably the only negative you will have here!

I love it because my bf does. Endless fries yummy can't get enough of there spiciest burger on the menu is the best.Good salads, Drinks and good price range. Friendly staff.There burgers could be a bit bigger. Man Vs Food Can I say hehe.

I haven't been to a Red Robin in like two or three years until recently, and I believe they revamped their menu. My usual order used to be the cod sandwich or this chicken pasta thing which they don't have anymore (pity because it was really, really good). I ordered the fish and chips which were great, the batter was crispy and light. Upon close inspection, the top half of my water glass was dirty. Kind of really off-putting. The table also seemed oily or something, definitely not clean. Over the years this location has definitely gone down. Our server was okay, attentive enough, but never refilled our fries.

I dont really like this place to be honest but one of their burgers was pretty good. I got the PRIME CHOPHOUSE BURGER the "new" burger they have for like $5.99 which is like half the price of the other burgers. I got it without dijon sauce and without the A1 peppercorn sauce because I guess their A1 peppercorn isnt served because it has a recall on it :( So without the A1 sauce it tastes kinda funny but whatever I guess its okay.The burgers there are not even that good and their overpriced. If I were to spend 9-15 bucks on a burger it better be GOOD. And these my friends are not that good.
Great service and great food. Great burgers and a nice menu selection. Of course they get busy especially Saturday nights. They do live up to the slogan Yummm! and have good customer service.

Always great food, great family place :)  Often thoe wait staff will bring yummy fries to hold you over before the food comes (works great to appease the kids). A friend recently left her license and credit card in the restaurant and Red Robin promptly sent it to her with a nice note- HONEST EMPLOYEES! Way to go, Red Robin!
Food is good. Service needs work. Poor management?

For the second time, my toddler has burnt his hands using the sink in the men's room. Each sink has only one knob which is set at scolding hot water. The first time it happened I told the manager and he assured me it would get fixed right away. But today it happened again. It was my fault for not remembering that the sinks at Red Robin are dangerous. When I complained again today, another guest overheard me and said that the sinks have been scolding hot for months and he's complained numerous times as well.  This seems like such a simple fix but Red Robin in Redlands is either too cheap to call a plumber or doesn't care that their customers are getting hurt.

Came to red robin on a slow Monday at 3:30pm. I was seated right away in the bar area. The server was nice and polite but that's all that was good about the trip. My girlfriend and I both ordered water. The cups were dirty and still had sticky, sugary residue on the inside of the cup that would fall into our water if we wiped it. We had ordered a royal robin burger cut in half to share and bottomless garlic fries. The cook brought our burger out but it was not cut in half and he just gave us an extra plate. That wasn't a big deal to us so we just cut the burger in half ourselves. When I tried to place the half of the burger on the other plate, it had cheese on the plate and was dirty. Then the cook brought us regular fries instead of the garlic ones we ordered. I told him and he went ahead and brought us our fries. The whole time our server was missing for ten minutes. We had to push the "call server" button on the ziosk to get her attention. I told her about the water and how dirty they were and she was polite and brought us new ones which were still dirty! Then we asked for more fries and she brought us regular fries again. We just accepted it and said we were never coming here again.

Yummy!  that's the word to begin.  We met our friends here for dinner, sat on the patio and had a fabulous time.  The food was excellent, the cocktails were delish and our waitress was superb.  I ordered the bleu cheese fancy burger (forgot the official name); my boyfriend ordered the prime rib sandwich with au jus; our friends split a sandwich as well.  I ordered the mango wine shake (oh my, so good!).  Since it was our friends birthday, our waitress and a few other staff members came over and sang him the b-day song and brought him a shake.  The patio seating was perfect; food was great...we'll be back to try some other menu items.
Great service, the server was Evan and he was really cool. The Blue Ribbon Burger cooked med rare is awesome!
This is my favorite Red Robin. Great service from all of the staff. They are always patient with my custom burger orders.

Huge burgers with every topping imaginable. Endless fries. Full bar. Taste buds reving yet? The only downside to this place is that it is very popular with families, so you might have to ask to be seated in the bar area to get away for the little darlings. The service is always friendly and fast, and the food is excellent.

Love this joint! Get the Cowboy sauce to dip your Fries! You won't regret it! Only had one minor problem here, just never come on a Friday night! Service is awful then. Mixed up our appetizer from half size wings then charged for the full size (Wings I wouldn't get, not the best) then the waitress was a smartass about it when we pointed it out and fixed the check.Oh and she kept slamming down our Coke refills while just walking by to go serve other tables, then didn't ask if we wanted dessert (we didnt want anything its the principle of nice courtesy that you ask even though 90% of people say no) so we took that as a sign of "Ok get the Hell out!" So for that I just won't come on a Friday night. I usually get the smaller basic double cheeseburger (Can't remember the name). The Towering Onion Rings and Jump starters are amazing appetizers!
Would be a five but its a chain. Great quick service on a weekend evening. Always have new items to try on the menu. This place is a family favorite. Lots of shopping nearby to walk it off.

There are only two places in town that I enjoy a good burger and this is definitely one of them.   I have never had to wait here and from what I can tell, the bad servers I have noticed over time seem to disappear like they should!  So, it balances out, decent service and great food.   It is a super kid friendly place which might be its biggest deal breaker for me, but it's not enough for me to complain.

Mmmm, Red Robin. What can I say? Any place that has free refills on french fries is a keeper! I have been here many times and almost always have a good experience.  Let me say this about servers: they don't impress me when they try to remember my order without writing it down. My boyfriend and I had a server that did this...poorly. Before he even left our table after taking our order, he basically asked us to repeat various parts of our order about 3 times. Anyway, that seems to be the exception rather than the rule so 4 stars it is. More fries, please.

I've never had a bad experience here, or at any other Red Robin for that matter! Last time I was in, I had the California Chicken Sandwich. It was AMAZING! I liked it more than any of the burgers I've ordered there! I highly recommend it if you're not in the mood for a burger.  I also had a small salad instead of french fries, as I was trying to eat healthier... and it was average, but their ranch dressing is super yummy! I'll probably order the fries with that ranch dressing next time =) Service was good. Sometimes you ge at the host stand for awhilet stuck waitng at the host stand for a bit, but once you sit down, you will feel well taken care of.

if I could give a no stars I would .....we waited about 10 minutes to be seated then got seated at a booth that was so dirty ....crumbs everywhere!!! then got moved to a table where again filthy food and crayons on the floor so gross ....we walked out witout ordering! do not eat at this dirty resturant!

While I do enjoy the food here the service is pretty awful. It doesn't matter what time you come here and how many people are in the restaurant, the service just stinks. They would definitely get an extra star from me if I didn't feel like the waitstaff hated their customers just for being there.

Loved it! As soon as we walked in I saw a plasma on the floor pretty dope if you ask me! I ordered the Burnin' Love Burger whuch was EPIC i loooove spicy food ask my fam i put spice on everything i cook. It had generous amount of chipotle sauce and jalapenos. Had two glasses of chardonnay to wash it down. The waiter which I dont know by name, he was friendly and helpful. Dark curly hair hipster lookin' dude with glasses. Lol I gives it 5 stars because their burgers are  beast! I remember going to red robins for the first time for my 16 bday and had a ball. Def will be coming,back!

I had the Whiskey BBQ burger...it was eh ok. I really expected a whole lot more from this place with all hte hype my friends gave, but I didn't get that from this place. If you want a real burger you need to go up to Running Springs and head on over to Papa Jack's Smoquehouse Bar-B-Que. Now there you'll get your burger and then some. Mos def a 5 star rating!!!

I've been here several times already, so I finally decided to write something. The restaurant is pretty clean and the service has been always good. The burger selections are pretty wide, so there's a specialty that will please someone. My favorite is the burnin love with no salsa, mushroom swiss and steak sliders (awesome if you don't feel like a burger). Oh and the whiskey river chicken wrap is also pretty tasty. They have unlimited fries with the burgers so you're sure to leave stuffed. They also have their seasoned salt on the table for a bit more flavoring to your food. Prices are $10 meal on average, which isn't bad. I approve this place.

The Burnin' Lovin' Burger is still my favorite. The fries are okay but you can't go wrong with bottomless, which is why they will up sell you on sweet potato fries or garlic fries so that your table can share as much as your heart desires. Just know that it'll be an extra $1.29 but it's worth it. Atmosphere is lively and fun. They're always busy so try to get there right before dinner time to avoid the wait.

Big Burgers ,BotTomless steak fries*Gluttony Alert*wit an option to have them sprinkled with parmesan&garlic!!U better hope your date loves those fries too cuz if u play your cards right...thatll be one Helluva french kiss!lol No calorie counting here and if u are u most likely went over the daily limit just smelling the food! Happy Hour specials guarantee u saying "Me i want mor prize pleez!" bumbln n mumbln haha...cant really go wrong wit this time tested combination for success...My only gripe with them is on my last visit da waitress that helped us sucked n the mushrooms n onion rings were overfried n my burger was too salty annnnnd?Fried rice?!annnnnnd??!WHAT?!(Dude wheres your sense of Humor?!).Management is slippn...should do some random quality checks n go over customer Service policies!

My family has always enjoyed eating at Red Robin. We moved near the Redlands CA Red robin a few months back. We have eaten there three times since then. All three times we received slow service, our drinks were not refilled without asking, half of the tables food(there are only 4 of us two of which are children) was cold, and bathrooms were a mess. I will not be going back to this particular location anytime soon. I don't recommend this particular location to others.

First time i ate at a Red Robin in many years. Saturday afternoon. Loud and busy. This is a new building so its clean and new looking. Which is what the uppity crowd tends to like. The service was good. Many people working in there. A couple of cute waitresses to make the food go down better. By the way. The food was average for this type of joint. The gourmet burger was about 9 bucks with fries. The patty was less than half cooked. The onions were very hot and no relish next time. Fries were good. Didnt try anything else. The burger had potential but needed some fine tuning. Probably be awhile b4 i go back. In and Out is closer and cheaper.
They have a sweet happy  hour now! 3-6 and 7-11 im pretty sure......drinks are yum and apps are awesome!

I have been to this location a few times since it opened, and have always received great service and good food. I came here on Monday because every year on my birthday they send me a coupon for a free burger (I love anyplace that gives you a whole meal for free and not just an ice cream sundae for being part of their "club"). We ordered the jalapeno rings for an appetizer and they were really good...surprisingly good! I also tried one of their watermelon margaritas and a long island iced tea (I forget their special name for that one) and both were really tasty, but lacking in the alcohol department. Got the bonzai burger (my fav!) and the the garlic parmesan fries and I was so stuffed by the end of the meal, but it was great! The service was fantastic and even though our waiter was super efficient, the manager was walking around checking on every table making sure we were all happy with our experience there. I will definately be back and hopefully I can think of an excuse to go there before my next free birthday burger comes around!
